notes: Summary: Hamlet asks his dad for the secret to a happy life.

3.title: Hagar the Horrible
3.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar has decided to spend more time with the wife and kids.

4.title: Hagar the Horrible
4.author: Chris Browne.
notes: (Listen to Your Mother : Helga Tells It Like It Is)

5.title: Hagar the Horrible
5.author: Chris Browne.
5.series: July 11, 1997) "Bird Watchers Tend to Live in Their Own Little World"*
notes: Summary: A man points out a rare bird, and Hagar isn't impressed.

6.title: Hagar the Horrible
6.author: Chris Browne.
6.series: July 17, 1997) "Do You Want To Drop Dead of a Heatstroke?"*
notes: Summary: Helga doesn't see the shower of arrows that Hagar is trying to outrun.

7.title: Hagar the Horrible
7.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Lucky Eddy asks if there'll be much fighting in Scotland. Hagar has his golf clubs just in case.

8.title: Hagar the Horrible
8.author: Chris Browne.
8.series: July 23, 1997) "Oh, It's a Recurring Thing. It Happens Every Time the Grass Needs Cutting"*
notes: Summary: Hagar is groaning and can't move, and Honi asks Helga what's wrong with Dad.

9.title: Hagar the Horrible
9.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar doesn't know the meaning of the word.
Key words: Vocabulary, ultimatums, death threats.

10.title: Hagar the Horrible
10.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: A successful raid makes Hagar almost forget his bad back, as Lucky Eddie carries an enormous sack.

11.title: Hagar the Horrible
11.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Speak for yourself, says Hagar, who has to support a family.
Key word: Pay, wives, children, ducks, dogs, quality of life.

12.title: Hagar the Horrible
12.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Helga is staring, trying to describe Hagar.
Key words: Arrows, tables, helmets. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Descriptions"

13.title: Hagar the Horrible
13.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Series: Listen to your Mother : Helga Tells It Like It Is.
Summary: It doesn't take much to make a wife happy.
Key words: Secrets, advice. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Happiness"

14.title: Hagar the Horrible
14.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: His wife's driving him crazy because he stops at the tavern, so why doesn't he go straight home?
Key words: Yelling, throwing things. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "Taverns"

15.title: Hagar the Horrible
15.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Helga asked for a French cookbook from Paris, but Hagar brought a chef.

16.title: Hagar the Horrible
16.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: The ship sank and Hagar only saved his golf clubs.

17.title: Hagar the Horrible
17.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar's siege of a castle has to be called off because of a sign in the front yard.

18.title: Hagar the Horrible
18.author: Chris Browne.
18.series: July 2, 1998) "He has his Good Days and Bad Days"*
notes: Summary: Has Snert developed into a valiant Viking dog? Right now he's been treed by a cat.

19.title: Hagar the Horrible
19.author: by Chris Browne.
19.series: July 24, 1998) "What Are You Making for Dinner Tonight?"*
notes: Summary: Hagar and Helga are on the beach, and Hagar makes a speech about how nice it is to have nothing to do but relax.

20.title: Hagar the Horrible
20.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar and his band are ready to loot a castle, but the owner wants to get in a game of golf first.

21.title: Hagar the Horrible

21.series: Aug. 13, 1998) "Sometimes Dogs are Smarter than you Think They Are"*

22.series: Sept. 16, 1998) "Obviously He Keeps Trying to Get Your Attention"*
notes: Summary: Helga thinks Hagar should break down and give Snert something to eat, as Snert hops around balancing things on his nose.

90.author: by Tim Makinen

notes: Announces new daily strips Frazz, Get Fuzzy, The Boondocks, Rose is Rose, Pickles, Red and Rover, and Brevity, and the discontinuing of Born Loser, Cathy, Classic Peanuts, Dennis the Menace, Hagar the Horrible, Marvin, and Rex Morgan M.D.

112.heading: Hagar the Horrible--Miscellanea.
112.title: Samples of Seven Deadly Sins
112.author: by J
notes: 48 leaves : ill. ; 28 cm.
A book proposal using reprints from the comic strips Hagar the Horrible (Dik Browne) and Snuffy Smith (Fred Lasswell) to discuss pride, gluttony, envy, sloth, covetousness, anger and lust.

114.heading: Hagar the Horrible--Miscellanea.
114.title: "Stay Away from Talking Frogs"
114.author: George J

notes: Retired editor of Milwaukee Journal reminisces about the strips and panels he bought for his paper, with samples and comments about 12 of them: Conrad, The Far Side, Herman, Calvin and Hobbes, Hagar, The Circus of P.T. Bimbo, For Better or For Worse, Garfield, Terry and the Pirates, Mother Goose & Grimm, The Muppets, and Shoe.

192.heading: Haggard, H. Rider (Henry Rider), 1856-1925--Miscellanea.
192.title: Over 50 Years of American Comic Books
192.author: Ron Goulart

196.title: Haggarth
196.author: Victor de la Fuente
notes: "Au coeur d'une mystérieuse forêt, chevauche un groupe de sauvages guerriers Tunas. A leur tête, Haggarth, leur chef inflexible, que rien ne semble pouvoir détourner d'accomplir sa mission. Mais le passage de la troupe sauvage, prête à défier la vie et la mort, n'échappe pas à l'attention des paysans de cette région désolée. Leur union, la seule force qu'ils possèdent, mettra-t-elle en échec les projets sacrilèges d'Haggarth? Victor de la Fuente renoue ici avec l'atmosphère lourde et oppressante des aventures de Haxtur, qui l'avaient révélé, il y a quelques années au public français."
"A suivre."

197.title: Haggarth
197.author: Victor de la Fuente
notes: "A la tête de son groupe de sauvages tuerriers tunas, Haggarth s'est envoncé dans une région désolée. Son but: dérober, dans un monastère, le crâne aux trois serpents. Cette relique est le symbole de paix et d'unité des paysans qui peuplent cette contrée montagneuse. Sa disparition signifierait que chaque chef de clan se réclamerait du droit de gouverner les autres et que, defant un armée divisée, ce territoire deviendrait une proie facile pour les Tunas. Face au péril, les paysans se regroupent pour affronter les hommes d'Haggarth, ceux qui 'défient la vie et la mort'. La lutte s'engage, âpre et sauvage. Fauché par la hache d'un paysan, Haggarth s'effondre."
"A suivre."

235.heading: Hags.
235.title: "You Exist to Serve Me"
235.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: Ms. Puffington says to Mrs. Scrubs, 'You're the maid, I'm the columnist', Brenda says that being a columnist is just a job, and Puffington says she makes three times as much as Starr.
Key words: Trashbag hag, salaries.

236.author: Sheldon Mayer, story ; Sam Glanzman, art

237.heading: Hague, Devon.
237.title: In the Small
237.author: written and illustrated by Michael Hague ; with Devon Hague.
notes: Advance reading copy.

"A blue light flashes. Within seconds, every human being is fewer than six inches tall. Mother Nature begins to exact her revenge on mankind. Now, a teenage brother and sister must lead the quest to discover the secret that could redeem this strange new world. But despite their courageous efforts for survival, a dark force grows."

238.heading: Hague, Devon.
238.title: In the Small
238.author: written and illustrated by Michael Hague with Devon Hague.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): When a mysterious cataclysmic event, "the blue flash," causes the population of the earth to shrink in size to six inches tall, suddenly humanity has the tables turned on itself: The very civilization it has created becomes its greatest obstacle to survival. Animals and the environment, which have long suffered under the rule and/or destruction of humans, are now some of their most feared enemies. Amid the confusion and turmoil, two strong teenagers, 18-year-old Mouse and his younger sister Beat, emerge as the most promising leaders, eventually setting out on a quest to discover the secret that could redeem this strange new world.
